review_title: Student jobs at BJU are great!
pros: I really loved working as an RA at BJU. It was a great ministry! I really loved being able to get to know the girls on my hall and help counsel them and help them when needed.
cons: I never got to go to bed early because I had to check to make sure the girls on my hall got back safely. As a tired college student it would have been nice to go to bed early sometimes.

review_title: Great opportunities but Basically Volunteer Work
pros:
As a RA at BJU I have had the opportunity to have an enormous impact on the life of my residents and help them progress through their academic careers. 
If you want an opportunity to work with people and help them grow I would recommend this position.
cons:
As an RA you can expect communication, pay, and reporting/management structure to be up to par if it were the late 1980's . 
The dorms are falling apart and in need of regular repair (This may not be a con in the near future as there is scheduled repair)
To communicate put the pay level in perspective my bi weekly check is equivalent two days work at my current summer job.

review_title: Good work environment, work can be a bit strange some times.

pros: Enjoyable work environment and camaraderie with coworkers.

review_title: Great people, great atmosphere, not a living wage.
pros: I love working for BJU, the people are great. The atmosphere is spiritually up building, People pray for each other here. As a photographer I have a lot of creative freedom.
cons: Burn out + very poor pay. The university is struggling financially. They can't pay their employees a living wage. A lot of employees need to moonlight with additional jobs on top of their full time work for BJU. Or their spouse is the breadwinner. Or in some cases they made their living elsewhere and are ministering at BJU as their retirement job. And on top of that the departments are shrinking with the demand of those departments not shrinking. So everyone is very over worked.

review_title: Recommend overall but not for everyone.
pros: It is a very good work environment. While this varies by department, I have excellent coworkers who are very easy to work with. Management is very good about expressing appreciation for work well done. In particular area, I have a lot of freedom to take initiative in projects that I think are worthwhile. Given justification/business cases, management is good about getting on board. While my job is not specifically education related, if you believe in the school's mission overall it can be more satisfying to work at BJU than elsewhere. Benefits as well as vacation time are good to above average.
cons:
There are some rather rigid requirements that infringe on personal freedoms (dress, movies, etc.). However, some of the dress standards did loosen up (although the main point is that there are still requirements imposed when not on the clock).

Name recognition can be the double-edged sword of working at BJU -- most people know of the school and many have definite opinions about (see John McCain for instance).

Some departments/supervisors are stuck back in 70's authoritarian management styles -- fortunately this isn't the majority in my experience.

You do also have to be careful not to get cynical while working in a Christian environment -- people are still people and while there's no smoking/cursing/yelling, there are still imperfections.

pros: You meet some great people
cons: Very low pay in a strict social environment (depending on the department you work in)

pros: Great experience and resume builder
cons: Low pay since students get minimum wage

review_title: Very challenging and promoted personal growth in countless ways
job_title: Dining Common Worker/Checkout Desk in Greenville, SC
pros: Very skilled bosses who truly cared about my well being. They gave me promotions and even transferred me to other jobs based upon what would be best for me. They looked out for my best interest
cons: Working in the dining common was difficult. I had to work every other Sunday. There are also some roles in the student life staff where we had to enforce rules that really should be removed or restructured.

review_title: Great work environment - friendly people. Lower range pay.

cons: Low pay, unless both spouses work, cannot make it on one BJU income. Would be OK for single person with cheap apartment.
